it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.utils.Observable<java.lang.String>
      • it.polimi.ingsw.model.Game

  • public class Game
extends Observable<java.lang.String>
    Contains all the pieces of the game, i.e. the cards (public objectives, tool cards) and the dice involved in the match (those in the round track, those in the draft pool and those in the dice bag). Contains a list of the players in the current game and a structure to manage all the turns and rounds. Every list contains elements according to the rules: 3 public objectives, 2-4 players and 12 tool cards. Dice are 90 in total and scattered across the above mentioned lists and the window patterns of each player.

      • setDraft

        public void setDraft()
        At the beginning of every round, gets a number of dice from the dice bag equal to the number of players multiplied by two, plus one. Inserts all the dice in the draft pool.

      • diceLeft

        public void diceLeft()
        Moves all the dice left in the draft pool to the round track.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()

      • useDie

        public void useDie(int playerId,
                   int x,
                   int y,
                   int die)
        Inserts a die - taken from the draft pool - in the window of a player, at the given coordinates (x, y). Then notify the player of the successful operation.
        Parameters:
        playerId - the ID of the player.
        x - the index of the row.
        y - the index of the column.
        die - the index of the die in the draft pool.

      • moveDie

        public void moveDie(int playerId,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    int a,
                    int b)
        Moves a die inside the window of a player, from given coordinates (x, y) to some new coordinates (a, b). In case tool card 12 is used, it is possible that the player wants to move only one die, therefore default out-of-bound coordinated are given to throw an exception. Then notify the player of the successful operation.
        Parameters:
        playerId - the ID of the player.
        x - the index of the row where the die is placed.
        y - the index of the column where the die is placed.
        a - the index of the row where the die is going to be moved.
        b - the index of the column where the die is going to be moved.

      • useToolCard

        public void useToolCard(int toolcard,
                        int player)
        Reduces the tokens available to the player (-1 if the tool card has not been used yet, -2 otherwise) and sets the toolcard as already used.
        Parameters:
        toolcard - the number of the tool card.
        player - the ID of the player.

      • canUseToolCard

        public boolean canUseToolCard(int toolcard,
                              int player)
        Returns true if the player has enough tokens to use a certain tool card and has not used a tool card yet.
        Parameters:
        toolcard - the number of the tool card.
        player - the ID of the player.
        Returns:
        true if the player is able to use the card; false otherwise.
